frameDefinitions: Words in the frame refer to any Document that has a legal status or conventional social significance.
This frame deals with a Healer treating and curing an Affliction (the injuries, disease, or pain) of the Patient, sometimes also mentioning the use of a particular Treatment or Medication.
An organic item, the Patient, has undergone the natural process of rotting  and decaying with a possible expression of the Degree to which the rotting has occurred.
An Operator manipulates the substructure of a System such that the System performs the function it was created for.
Two (or more) people (the Parties, also encodable as Party_1 and Party_2) have an agreement.
These words describe the recovery or healing of a Patient from an Affliction without reference to the influence of any Treatment or Healer (see the Cure frame).  ''
frameExamples: They got their marriage <t>licence</t> from Canada.
Isis then <t>cured</t> Re by reciting a spell.
This true story of domestic bliss was related to me by a friend of mine who for a time <t>operated</t> a bar in San Francisco.
The US and Russia have an <t>agreement</t> to share early warning data on missile launches.
My injuries had not yet completely <t>healed</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: The holder of the document.
The authority that issues the document.
Obligation is the obligation that is imposed on the <fen>Bearer</fen> of the <fen>Document</fen>.
Right is the right of the <fen>Bearer</fen> of the <fen>Document</fen>  that is authorized by the <fen>Document</fen>.
Status is the state of the Bearer of the Document indicated by the Document.
Document is the piece of paper that has the legal status.
The  Healer, anyone who treats or cures the Patient, occurs as the External Argument of verbs:

This   is the sufferer of the injury, disease or pain and can occur as an NP Object in this frame. However, Patient may not be expressed as a separate Frame Element but frequently occurs as the possessor of the Affliction, an example of  role Conflation:  (See section on Conflation.)
The Frame Element Affliction is generally the NP Object of a verb, frequently incorporating the Patient as a possessor, as described above:
The role Treatment is used for treatments and means, distinguished by separate FEs in FN-1.
The injested, applied, injected, etc. substance designed to cure the Patient.
The <fen>Body_part</fen> is the specific area of the <fen>Patient</fen>'s body which is treated.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the organic matter that has decayed.
The entity that  the <fen>Operator</fen> gets to perform its intended function.
The invididual who manipulates the substructure of the <fen>System</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Operator</fen> runs the <fen>System</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Operator</fen> runs the <fen>System</fen>.

The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e. agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.
The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with).
An expression of the commitment of the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered by the agreement.
The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in having an agreement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the agreement was made.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an agreement was made.
The    Patient may either be expressed as the External Argument or, as in Health.Cure, may occur as the possessor of the Affliction (an example of role conflation):
This role is the injury, pain or disease experienced by the Patient.  Affliction occurs either as an External Argument of verbs or as a PP Complement of nouns or verbs:
Where Body Part is expressed as a separate constituent (rather than in phrases such as <ment>the wound on Pat's arm</ment>), it occurs as an External Argument:
The time at which the recovery takes place.
The location where the recovery takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>My </fex> visa will expire next month.
<fex>US consulate</fex> issued a Visa to Ms. Yang to travel to San Francisco.
They were all under subpoena <fex>to appear in court.</fex>
Raymond has a <fex>fishing</fex> licence.
The couple just got their <fex>marriage</fex> certificate.
The police need a search <fex><t>warrant</t></fex> to enter his house.
<fex>Doctors</fex> alleviated his suffering.
Acupuncture cured <fex>Pat</fex> of his depression.
This potion heals <fex>a broken heart</fex>.
He emphasized treatment <fex>by surgical means</fex>.
He needs prolonged treatment <fex>with anibiotics</fex>.
<fex>The coconut milk</fex> became rancid.
Robert Faye, who has run <fex>the organization</fex> since its inception in 1991, said all the money the group has raised has been properly distributed.
<fex>WELS Kingdom Workers</fex> operates this program for students interested in doing ministry for a summer job.

This guaranteed donation to the charity was begun by Eric Von Stroh, Mike Cioli
and Andrew Seligson, the three men who ran the business <fex>last year</fex>.
North Korea Operates a Restaurant <fex>in Vietnam</fex>.
<fex>AOL 's</fex> agreement with the ACLU will soon expire , and renogotiation is not a real possibility .
Mozilla Foundation now has a bindingagreement <fex>with America Online</fex>.
The US and Russia have an agreement <fex>to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.
Some types of alloy steel have been covered in the expiring <fex>trade</fex> agreement.
<fex>The US and Russia</fex> have an agreement to cooperate in destroying surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.
The missile agreement <fex>of 1952</fex> was still in force, however.
The <fex>Kyoto</fex> treaty has so far been relatively ineffectual.
<fex>Pat</fex> is convalescing from surgery.
<fex>The wound</fex> is healing well.
<fex>Pat's arm</fex> healed up quickly.
